name: Amaterasu
description: From her celestial throne in Takamagahara, she unleashes the dawn's first light, a blinding radiance that scours all darkness from the battlefield.

name: Jade Emperor
description: With a single, silent judgment from his heavenly palace, he commands the celestial bureaucracy, rewriting the fate of gods and mortals alike.

name: Anu
description: Seated in the highest heaven, he is the silent sky father from whom all divine right flows. His decree is the unshakeable foundation of reality.

name: Indra
description: He rides the storm clouds, his thunderous laughter echoing as he hurls the Vajra. Where it strikes, mountains crumble and empires fall.

name: Hwanin
description: The Emperor of Heaven looks down from the highest sky, his gaze a silent law that binds the cosmos. All gods bow to his supreme, unquestionable will.

name: Pangu
description: Born from a cosmic egg, his awakening shattered the chaos. With his body he formed the mountains and rivers, forever the world's primordial architect.

name: Izanagi
description: Wielding the jeweled spear Ame-no-nuboko, he churned the chaotic sea of creation, bringing forth the first islands with a single divine stir.

name: Enlil
description: His voice is the howling wind, his breath the raging storm. As the Lord of the Command, his word shapes and shatters the very earth.

name: Durga
description: A ten-armed goddess of divine fury, she rides her lion into the heart of battle. The demon hordes scatter before her righteous, unyielding onslaught.

name: Susanoo-no-Mikoto
description: Banished from the heavens, this tempestuous god of the sea and storms finds redemption by slaying the eight-headed serpent, his rage a force of nature.

name: Marduk
description: He slew the primordial dragon Tiamat, crafting the heavens and earth from her remains. Now, he holds the Tablet of Destinies, the arbiter of all fates.

name: Enki
description: A cunning trickster and master of the watery abyss, he shapes the world with his profound wisdom and safeguards humanity with clever, divine intervention.

name: Ganesha
description: With a gentle smile, the elephant-headed god removes any obstacle in his path. He is the wise lord of new beginnings and prosperous ventures.

name: Nuwa
description: When the heavens collapsed, she mended the sky with five-colored stones. From the yellow earth, she sculpted the first humans, the mother of all.

name: Ashur
description: The winged sun of the Assyrian empire, he is the divine embodiment of conquest. His presence on the battlefield guarantees absolute victory.

name: Tsukuyomi-no-Mikoto
description: Ruler of the night, he governs the silent world beneath the moon's cold gaze. His authority over time and tide is absolute.

name: Sun Wukong
description: This irrepressible monkey king, born from a stone, wields a staff that can calm the oceans and leaps across continents in a single bound.

name: Erlang Shen
description: His third eye sees through all illusion and deception. With his celestial hound at his side, no evil can escape his righteous pursuit.

name: Hachiman
description: The divine spirit of the samurai, his presence inspires warriors to impossible feats of courage. He is the sacred protector of the path of the warrior.

name: Agni
description: As the sacred fire, he is the messenger who carries mortal prayers to the heavens. His flames consume all offerings, bridging the gap between worlds.

name: Ishtar
description: Goddess of love and war, she descends from the heavens in a chariot of lions. Her passion can create life or utterly destroy it.

name: Kali
description: She wears a necklace of skulls, her dark form a terrifying sight to the wicked. She dances on the battlefield, the embodiment of time and destruction.

name: Raijin
description: He leaps between clouds, pounding on his drums to create the symphony of thunder. Each beat unleashes a torrent of devastating lightning upon the world below.

name: Fujin
description: From the bag he carries, he unleashes the four winds. A gentle breeze or a destructive hurricane, both are his to command.

name: Shamash
description: The sun god who sees all. He illuminates the darkest secrets and brings inescapable justice to those who hide in the shadows.

name: Dragon King
description: From his crystal palace at the bottom of the ocean, he commands the tides and summons the rain, holding the power of life-giving water in his claws.

name: Surya
description: He drives his golden chariot across the sky, a blazing beacon of light and life. His seven horses are the seven days of the week, an endless cycle of power.

name: Hwanung
description: Descending from the heavens with three divine seals, he brought law, agriculture, and medicine to the mortal world, establishing the first city of the gods.

name: Kagutsuchi
description: Born of fire, his very existence is a blazing inferno. The world trembles at his touch, for he is the untamable, destructive nature of flame itself.

name: Nezha
description: Riding his wind-fire wheels, this lotus-born warrior god challenges any authority. His rebellious spirit is as sharp as the spear he wields.

name: Varuna
description: The all-seeing guardian of cosmic order, he presides over the celestial ocean. No secret is hidden from him; no oath can be broken in his presence.

name: Ereshkigal
description: From her throne in the land of no return, she rules the silent darkness of the underworld. Her grip on the souls of the dead is absolute and eternal.

name: Saraswati
description: She sits upon a white lotus, her veena playing the music of creation. From her flows all knowledge, art, and wisdom in the universe.

name: Lakshmi
description: Born from the churning of the cosmic ocean, she bestows fortune and prosperity with a simple glance. Golden coins flow from her hands, a river of endless wealth.

name: Guanyin
description: The Bodhisattva of a Thousand Hands, she hears the cries of every soul in need. Her compassion is a boundless ocean, offering salvation to all.

name: Parvati
description: The gentle mother goddess, her devotion holds the power to tame even the wildest of gods. But when roused, her fury is a force that can shake the cosmos.

name: Inari Okami
description: Patron of the rice fields and lord of the kitsune, Inari's favor brings bountiful harvests and clever fortune. His messengers are the swift white foxes.

name: Nabu
description: The celestial scribe who records the fate of every living being on his sacred clay tablets. To know his script is to know the future itself.

name: Zhu Rong
description: The master of divine fire, he taught mortals its secrets. He rides a tiger through the southern skies, a harbinger of warmth and righteous fury.

name: Skanda
description: Commander of the celestial armies, he rides his peacock into battle against demonic forces. His spear, the Vel, never misses its mark.

name: Dangun
description: Born of a bear-woman and a god's son, he founded the first Korean kingdom. His legacy is the spiritual foundation of a nation.

name: Hanuman
description: This divine monkey can grow to the size of a mountain or shrink to the size of a gnat. His devotion to righteousness grants him unimaginable strength.

name: Ninurta
description: The divine warrior and farmer, he wields the magical mace Sharur. He defends creation from monstrous chaos and ensures the land remains fertile.

name: Mazu
description: A mortal girl who became a goddess, she calmly walks the stormy seas to guide sailors to safety. Her lantern is a beacon of hope in the darkest tempest.

name: Bishamonten
description: This armored warrior god stands guard in the north, a treasure pagoda in one hand and a spear in the other. He crushes evil and protects sacred treasures.

name: Caishen
description: He descends from the heavens riding a black tiger, bestowing unimaginable wealth and prosperity upon those he deems worthy. His touch turns stone to gold.

name: Yama
description: The first mortal to die, he now serves as the solemn judge of the underworld. His dharma is absolute, and no soul can escape his final verdict.

name: Haemosu
description: The son of heaven, he descended in a five-dragon chariot. His mastery of archery was so great he could challenge the sun itself.

name: Chang'e
description: She stole the elixir of immortality and fled to the moon. Now she lives in a cold, lonely palace, a beautiful and distant lunar goddess.

name: Sin
description: The lord of the crescent moon, he sails his glowing barge across the night sky. He governs the passing of months and the secrets of the darkness.

name: Ryujin
description: The dragon king of the sea, he controls the tides with the magical tide jewels. From his palace of coral, he commands a vast army of sea creatures.

name: Kamadeva
description: He fires arrows of sugarcane tipped with flowers, striking gods and mortals alike with uncontrollable passion. His bow is the sweet whisper of desire.

name: Shennong
description: The Divine Farmer tasted hundreds of herbs to discover their medicinal properties. His legacy is the knowledge of healing and the bounty of the harvest.

name: Daikokuten
description: With his magical mallet and a bag full of treasures, this cheerful god brings wealth and prosperity to the household. He stands upon bales of rice, a symbol of plenty.

name: Nisaba
description: The goddess of scribes and accounts, she etched the first stories into clay. All knowledge, from sacred texts to simple harvests, is under her domain.

name: Ame-no-Uzume
description: Her scandalous, joyful dance was enough to lure the sun goddess out of a dark cave. Her laughter can banish even the deepest despair.

name: Samsin Halmoni
description: This grandmother goddess ties the fates of children before they are born, guiding them into the world and watching over their first years of life.

name: Benzaiten
description: The goddess of all that flows, from the babbling brook to the eloquent speech of a poet. She carries a biwa, and her music can charm dragons.

name: Gonggong
description: A furious water god, his rage once caused him to smash his head against a pillar of heaven, tilting the very sky and earth.

name: Chandra
description: He rides his chariot across the night sky, pulled by ten white horses. As the moon, he governs the dew that nourishes all plant life.

name: Adad
description: He holds the lightning and thunder in his hands. His storms can bring life-giving rain to the parched desert or flash floods that destroy everything in their path.

name: Yebisu
description: The cheerful, deaf god of fishermen. Even if he cannot hear your prayers, his infectious good luck ensures a bountiful catch and prosperous trade.

name: Lei Gong
description: The Duke of Thunder, he uses a drum and mallet to create his storms, punishing hidden evil with bolts of heavenly lightning.

name: Vayu
description: The swift and unseen god of the wind. He is the breath of the world, a powerful force that can be a gentle zephyr or a destructive gale.

name: Tenjin
description: Once a mortal scholar unjustly exiled, he became a god of learning and calligraphy. Students pray to him for success in their exams.

name: Dagon
description: The Lord of the Harvest, he taught humanity the art of the plow. His blessings ensure the grain grows tall and the fields are forever fertile.

name: Wenchang Wang
description: A constellation of stars forming a celestial deity, he guides the brush of scholars and poets, ensuring their success and literary fame.

name: Ashnan
description: The gentle goddess of grain, she represents the nourishing power of the harvest. Her presence is a promise that hunger will be kept at bay.

name: Kichijoten
description: Her beauty is so great that it brings happiness and good fortune to all who gaze upon her. She holds a wish-granting jewel in her hand.

name: Yue Lao
description: The old man under the moon, he tirelessly ties the invisible red string of fate, binding together those destined to be lovers, regardless of time or distance.

name: Dhanvantari
description: He emerged from the cosmic ocean holding a pot of the nectar of immortality. As the physician of the gods, he can cure any disease.

name: Utu
description: The Sumerian sun god, he travels through the underworld at night to judge the dead, re-emerging at dawn to bring light and truth to the living.

name: Fukurokuju
description: An old man with an impossibly long forehead, he is accompanied by a crane and a turtle. He holds the secrets to a long, happy, and wise life.

name: Rati
description: The beautiful goddess of passion, she is the consort of the love god Kamadeva. Her presence inspires desire and carnal pleasure.

name: Apsara
description: These celestial dancers emerge from the clouds, their beauty and grace captivating even the most stoic gods. Their dance can sway the fate of battles.

name: Jurojin
description: Accompanied by a black deer, this ancient god of longevity carries a staff from which hangs a scroll containing all the wisdom of the world.

name: Hotei
description: The fat, laughing monk with a cloth sack that never empties. He wanders the land spreading cheer and giving gifts to the needy.

name: Cangjie
description: He invented writing after observing the tracks of birds and beasts. His four eyes could pierce the secrets of creation.

name: Zao Jun
description: The Kitchen God quietly observes the deeds of every family. Once a year, he ascends to heaven to report their conduct to the Jade Emperor.

name: Lu Ban
description: The patron deity of carpenters, his skill was so legendary he was said to have created flying wooden birds. A true master of the craft.

name: Ksitigarbha
description: This patient bodhisattva has sworn not to achieve enlightenment until all hells are empty. He is a guide and protector to souls lost in the darkness.

name: Ushas
description: The ever-youthful goddess of the dawn, she rides a golden chariot, gently waking the world and chasing away the oppressive darkness.

name: Nammu
description: The primordial goddess of the abyss, the vast and silent sea from which the first gods were born. She is the ultimate source of all creation.

name: Ninkasi
description: She is the goddess of brewing, her song the hymn of fermentation. From her golden vats flows the divine beer that brings joy to gods and mortals.

name: Ji Gong
description: A mad monk with divine powers, he broke all the rules but always helped the common people. His tattered fan could perform miracles.

name: Jizo
description: A gentle monk who protects the souls of children and travelers. His statues line the roads, offering silent comfort and guidance.

name: Bixia
description: The Princess of the Azure Clouds who watches over childbirth from her sacred mountain. She is a steadfast guardian of women and children.

name: Menshen
description: Two fierce generals who were appointed as divine door guardians. They stand ever-vigilant, barring evil spirits from entering the home.

name: Apsu
description: The personification of the sweet, fresh water that flows beneath the earth. From his silent, dark domain, all life-giving rivers are born.

name: Dhatri
description: A minor sun god who ensures the proper health and function of the body's limbs. He is a divine bringer of domestic peace and well-being.

name: Garuda
description: The king of birds, a sworn enemy of all serpents. His mighty wings can block out the sun, and his speed is faster than the wind.

name: Nandi
description: The loyal white bull who serves as the mount for greater gods. His patient gaze holds deep wisdom, and his bell rings with divine truth.

name: Toyotama-hime
description: The 'Luminous Pearl Princess,' a beautiful sea goddess who married a mortal man but was forced to return to her father's underwater kingdom.

name: Ashvins
description: Twin horsemen who gallop across the sky at dawn, bringing healing and good fortune. They are divine physicians who can restore youth and even life.

name: Changxi
description: The mother of the twelve moons, she bathes her children in a lake in the west, ensuring the lunar cycle continues in perfect harmony.

name: Kuraokami
description: A dragon deity born from the blood of the fire god Kagutsuchi. This powerful being has dominion over rain, snow, and ice.

name: Lahmu
description: A hairy, bestial deity born from the primordial silt. He serves as a guardian and gatekeeper to the celestial temple of Enki.

name: Yuyutsu
description: The only Kaurava who chose righteousness over his family's evil. He stands as a quiet testament to the power of a just conscience.

name: Iktomi
description: A spider-trickster who uses his cunning to fool the boastful and the foolish. Though not a god, his schemes can alter the plans of divine beings.

name: Yajata
description: A host of benevolent spirits who aid the higher gods in their fight against darkness. They are the 'Venerable Ones,' worthy of praise.

name: Zeus
description: From his throne on Olympus, he hurls bolts of pure lightning, his judgment shaking the foundations of the world. The sky itself bows to his will.

name: Odin
description: The All-Father hangs from the world tree, sacrificing an eye for ultimate wisdom. His ravens, Thought and Memory, bring him news from all nine realms.

name: Ra
description: Each day, he journeys across the sky in his solar barge, bringing light to the world. At night, he battles the serpent of chaos to ensure the dawn will rise again.

name: Jupiter
description: The greatest of the Roman gods, his eagle is the symbol of the empire's might. He is the divine guardian of law, order, and absolute power.

name: The Dagda
description: The 'Good God' of the Irish pantheon, his club can slay nine men with one blow or restore life with the other. His cauldron provides an endless feast.

name: Poseidon
description: With a strike of his trident, he summons earthquakes and tidal waves. The untamed power of the ocean is his to command, a force of creation and destruction.

name: Hades
description: The silent king of the underworld, his helm of darkness grants him invisibility. He rules over the vast wealth of the earth and the countless souls of the dead.

name: Thor
description: The son of Odin, he defends both gods and mortals with his mighty hammer, Mjölnir. The sound of its impact is the thunder in the storm.

name: Osiris
description: Betrayed and resurrected, he is the eternal king of the afterlife. He weighs the hearts of the dead against a feather, delivering a just and final verdict.

name: Lugh
description: Master of all arts and skills, the 'Shining One' led his people to victory with an unstoppable magical spear. No task is beyond his capability.

name: Hera
description: Queen of Olympus, her divine authority over marriage is absolute. The peacock, with its thousand eyes, is her sacred animal, a symbol of her eternal vigilance.

name: Isis
description: Her magic is so powerful she brought her murdered husband back to life. A mother, a queen, and a sorceress, she is the throne of all Egypt.

name: The Morrigan
description: A phantom queen who circles the battlefield as a crow, weaving the fates of warriors. Her chilling shriek foretells doom and glorious death.

name: Apollo
description: He drives the sun chariot across the sky, his arrows bringing either sudden plague or gentle healing. His lyre plays the music of the cosmos.

name: Saturn
description: The ancient god of time and harvest, he once presided over a Golden Age of prosperity. His sickle reaps what has been sown, both grain and destiny.

name: Athena
description: Born fully armed from the head of Zeus, she is the goddess of brilliant strategy and righteous warfare. The wise owl is her constant companion.

name: Frigg
description: Odin's queen, she weaves the clouds in the sky and knows the fate of all beings. Though she knows the future, she rarely speaks of it.

name: Horus
description: The falcon-headed god who defeated his uncle Set to avenge his father. His eye, lost and restored, is a powerful symbol of protection and healing.

name: Ares
description: The embodiment of bloodlust and the chaotic frenzy of battle. He delights in the clash of shields and the cries of the fallen, thriving in pure violence.

name: Mars
description: The protector of Rome, he is a disciplined and honorable god of war. He fights not for glory, but for the preservation and strength of his people.

name: Freya
description: She rides a chariot pulled by cats and claims half of the warriors slain in battle for her hall. A goddess of love, beauty, and fierce independence.

name: Anubis
description: The jackal-headed guide of the dead, he presides over the embalming ritual. He holds the scales of justice, ensuring the heart is weighed with perfect fairness.

name: Hephaestus
description: The master craftsman of the gods, cast from Olympus for his lameness. From his forge within a volcano, he creates divine weapons and wondrous automata.

name: Loki
description: The silver-tongued trickster and shapeshifter. His clever schemes and malicious pranks constantly sow chaos among the gods of Asgard.

name: Thoth
description: The ibis-headed god of knowledge, he is the divine scribe who invented writing. His wisdom is so vast that he mediates disputes between the gods.

name: Hermes
description: With winged sandals, he moves between the mortal and divine worlds with impossible speed. A trickster, a messenger, and a guide for souls on their final journey.

name: Demeter
description: When her daughter was stolen, her grief brought winter to the world. She is the goddess of the harvest, her mood dictating the cycle of the seasons.

name: Cernunnos
description: The horned lord of the forest, he sits among the wild beasts as their protector and king. He is the raw, untamed spirit of nature.

name: Heimdall
description: The ever-watchful guardian of Asgard's Bifrost bridge. He can hear grass growing and see for a hundred leagues, and his horn will signal the start of Ragnarök.

name: Set
description: The god of the harsh desert, chaos, and foreign lands. He murdered his brother Osiris, embodying the violent and untamable forces of the world.

name: Artemis
description: The virgin goddess of the hunt, she roams the wilderness with her band of nymphs. Her silver arrows fly true, a protector of the wild and the young.

name: Brigit
description: Her domain is the sacred flame of the forge, the spark of poetic inspiration, and the gentle touch of healing. She is the triple goddess of creation.

name: Tyr
description: The one-handed god of justice and honor. He bravely sacrificed his hand to the monstrous wolf Fenrir, proving his courage and commitment to the law.

name: Hel
description: The half-dead, half-living queen of the Norse underworld. She rules with a grim and impartial authority over those who die of sickness or old age.

name: Neptune
description: The Roman ruler of the deep, he commands legions of sea creatures. His power extends from the vast oceans to the smallest freshwater spring.

name: Aphrodite
description: Born from the sea foam, her divine beauty can spark desire in the hearts of gods and mortals, often leading to both passion and chaos.

name: Freyr
description: The Norse god of sunshine and fair weather, he sails a magical ship that can be folded to fit in his pocket. His rule brings peace and prosperity to the land.

name: Dionysus
description: The god of wine and revelry, his followers enter a state of ecstatic madness. He represents liberation from the ordinary and the wildness within.

name: Bastet
description: Once a fierce lioness goddess, she was tamed into the cat-headed protector of the home. She brings joy and guards against evil spirits.

name: Manannan mac Lir
description: The Irish sea god who rides a magical horse across the waves. He guards the misty gate to the Otherworld, a master of illusion and magic.

name: Juno
description: The watchful and majestic queen of the Roman gods. She is a fierce protector of marriage and the state, often acting with a queen's righteous fury.

name: Baldr
description: The most beloved of the Norse gods, he was so beautiful that he gave off light. He was immune to all harm, save for the humble mistletoe.

name: Sekhmet
description: The lion-headed goddess of destruction, her breath is the hot desert wind. She was created to punish humanity, her bloodlust nearly unquenchable.

name: Nuada
description: The king of the Tuatha Dé Danann who lost his arm in battle and had it replaced with one of silver. He is a symbol of just leadership and perseverance.

name: Minerva
description: The Roman goddess of wisdom and strategic arts. Unlike Mars, she champions war only for a just cause, preferring the wisdom of peace.

name: Persephone
description: The queen of the underworld who was once a goddess of spring. Her annual return to the surface brings the world back to life after the cold of winter.

name: Ptah
description: The creator god of Memphis, who brought the world into being simply by thinking of it and speaking its name. He is the patron of all craftsmen.

name: Vulcan
description: The Roman god of the forge, his hammer rings within the fiery heart of volcanoes. He crafts the thunderbolts for Jupiter and armor for heroes.

name: Njord
description: The god of the calm sea coast, he blesses sailors and fishermen with good fortune. His home is by the sea, where he enjoys the cry of the gulls.

name: Hathor
description: The joyous cow goddess of love, music, and motherhood. Her festivals were filled with dance and drink, and she was beloved by all.

name: Aengus Og
description: The Irish god of love, four swans circle his head as he walks. His words are so sweet that they can charm anyone who hears them.

name: Mercury
description: The swift messenger of the Roman gods, he guides commerce and protects travelers. He is also a cunning trickster and a guide for souls to the afterlife.

name: Idun
description: The cheerful goddess who tends the golden apples of immortality. Without her fruit, the Norse gods would age and wither like mortals.

name: Sobek
description: The fearsome crocodile god of the Nile, his power is as sudden and deadly as a reptile's attack. Yet he also represents the fertility the river brings.

name: Dian Cecht
description: The master physician of the Irish gods. His healing well could restore the mortally wounded to fight another day, making his army unstoppable.

name: Janus
description: The two-faced god who looks to the past and the future simultaneously. He is the keeper of all doorways, gates, and moments of transition.

name: Bragi
description: The skald of the gods, his tongue is carved with runes of poetry. His words can inspire armies and bring tears to the eyes of the most hardened warrior.

name: Epona
description: The goddess of horses, she is always depicted with her noble steeds. She gallops across the land, a symbol of freedom, power, and fertility.

name: Hestia
description: The gentlest of the Olympians, she is the goddess of the sacred hearth fire. She represents the warmth, stability, and sanctity of the home.

name: Forseti
description: The god of justice who dwells in a shining hall of gold and silver. He can mediate any dispute, and all who leave his court do so in peace.

name: Ceres
description: The nurturing Roman mother of the harvest. Her love for her daughter is so strong that her emotions control the changing of the seasons.

name: Ma'at
description: The goddess of cosmic order, truth, and justice. It is her white feather that is weighed against the hearts of the dead in the final judgment.

name: Taranis
description: The Celtic wheel-god of the sky, his passing is the rumbling of thunder. He is often associated with storms and the power of the heavens.

name: Khonsu
description: The Egyptian god of the moon, he travels across the night sky. He is a protector of nighttime travelers and a powerful force against evil.

name: Vesta
description: The Roman guardian of the sacred flame that protected the city. She embodies the home, the family, and the enduring spirit of the Roman people.

name: Ullr
description: The glorious god of the hunt, he glides through the winter landscape on his skis, his bow ever ready. He is the master of the winter hunt.

name: Bacchus
description: The Roman god of wine, whose rites involve wild celebration and liberation from societal norms. He is the spirit of untamed joy and madness.

name: Arawn
description: The grim king of the Welsh underworld, he rides with his pack of spectral white hounds. To hear their baying is an omen of death.

name: Skadi
description: A giantess who became a goddess of winter and the hunt. She lives in the high mountains, preferring the howl of the wolf to the sounds of the sea.

name: Sulis
description: A Celtic goddess whose power resides in the hot springs of Bath. Her sacred waters were believed to have potent healing and curative properties.

name: Nemesis
description: The winged goddess of righteous indignation. She brings ruin to the arrogant and distributes fortune with an unerring sense of divine justice.

name: Eir
description: A valkyrie who is also the greatest of all healers. Her knowledge of herbs and charms can mend even the most grievous wounds sustained in battle.

name: Concordia
description: The Roman goddess who fosters harmony among citizens. Her presence ensures that agreements are kept and that peace prevails within the city.

name: Goibniu
description: The master smith of the Irish gods, he forges weapons that always hit their mark and never break. He also brews the ale of immortality.

name: Hebe
description: The goddess of youth, she serves the nectar and ambrosia that keep the Olympians eternally young. Her presence is a refreshing spring.

name: Iris
description: She travels on the rainbow, a swift and gentle messenger for the gods. Her duty is to deliver divine commands, not with thunder, but with light.

name: Sif
description: Thor's wife, her glorious golden hair was crafted by dwarves and is said to represent the fields of wheat, a symbol of a bountiful harvest.

name: Fortuna
description: The blind goddess of luck, she turns the wheel of fortune at random. Riches or ruin, triumph or despair—all are subject to her whim.

name: Pan
description: The wild god of the shepherds, his pipes echo through the lonely mountains. His sudden appearance could inspire a mindless, panicked terror in travelers.

name: Geb
description: The god of the earth, he is the ground upon which all life walks. Earthquakes are said to be his laughter, echoing up from below.

name: Boann
description: The goddess of the River Boyne, she created the river by defying a sacred well. The waters now carry her ancient, poetic knowledge.

name: Flora
description: The whimsical goddess of all things that bloom. She wanders the fields in spring, and flowers blossom in her footsteps.

name: Khepri
description: The scarab beetle god who tirelessly rolls the sun across the sky each morning. He is the symbol of rebirth and the promise of a new day.

name: Asclepius
description: A mortal physician so skilled he could cheat death itself. For his hubris, he was struck down by Zeus but was honored with a place in the stars.

name: Sol
description: The Norse goddess of the sun, she is forever chased across the sky by the wolf Sköll. Her daily flight is a race against the coming of darkness.

name: Pomona
description: A quiet nymph of the Roman woodlands, she cares for the fruit trees and orchards. She is the goddess of a bountiful, fruitful harvest.

name: Nike
description: The winged goddess of victory, she swoops down to the battlefield to reward the triumphant with a laurel wreath and everlasting glory.

name: Mani
description: The Norse god of the moon, he is forever pursued across the night sky by the wolf Hati. He guides the lonely travelers of the night.

name: Airmid
description: The Irish goddess of healing herbs. After her brother was slain, all the healing herbs of the world grew from the tears she shed on his grave.

name: Hapi
description: The androgynous god of the Nile's annual flood. He brings the fertile black silt that allows Egypt to flourish in the middle of the desert.

name: Creidne
description: The skilled bronzesmith of the Irish gods. He worked with Goibniu and Luchta to craft the magical weapons for the Tuatha Dé Danann.

name: Tyche
description: The Greek counterpart to Fortuna, she juggles a ball, representing the unpredictability of luck. She often carries a cornucopia, a horn of plenty.

name: Luchta
description: The divine carpenter of the Tuatha Dé Danann. He could fashion a thousand spear shafts in a single night, all of them perfectly balanced and ready for war.

name: Aurora
description: The Roman goddess of the dawn. She flies across the sky each morning, her tears becoming the morning dew, as she heralds the arrival of the sun.

name: Vidar
description: The silent god of vengeance. He is destined to survive Ragnarök and will avenge his father Odin by slaying the great wolf Fenrir.

name: Bellona
description: The Roman goddess of war, she is not about strategy, but the brutal, bloody reality of the battlefield. She revels in the chaos of conflict.

name: Nut
description: The goddess of the sky, her star-covered body arches over the earth, separating it from the chaos of the cosmos. She swallows the sun each evening to give birth to it at dawn.

name: Gefjun
description: A Norse goddess of plowing and fertility. It is said she plowed the entire island of Zealand from the land of a Swedish king in a single night.

name: Morpheus
description: The god of dreams, he can take on any human form to deliver messages to mortals as they sleep. He is the shaper of fantasies and nightmares.

name: Luna
description: The Roman goddess of the moon, she drives her silver chariot across the night sky. She is a silent witness to the secrets of the darkness.
